TOPIC 1: I've been thinking alot about decisions and how I make them. Decisions make me who I am, so it's mind altering to ponder this topic in detail when you discover that many of your decisions aren't made by 'you' %[Meh](postback:no_topic_1) %[Interesting, tell me more](postback:topic_1_2)
TOPIC 1 2:
Many of our decisions are made by a few pre-hardwired responses to the 400 billion bits of information per second that reach your brain.
 We can only process about 2,000 bits that are used and make us aware of our surroundings.
Decisions we make instinctivly, or based on intuiting, are often made by what we call heuristics. We don't consiously make these decisions, we just act.
NO TOPIC 1: Cool, I get it. Decisions are not interesting. Want to talk about curiosity? %[sure!](postback:topic_2) %[maybe later](postback:no_topic_2)

TOPIC 2 2: In existentialism, authenticity is the degree to which you are true to your own personality, spirit, or character, despite external pressures.
